pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Nova Scotia Premier Stephen McNeil | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with Nova Scotia Premier Stephen McNeil.

Prime Minister Trudeau expressed his deepest condolences to the grieving families and friends of the victims of last week’s mass shooting, and all Nova Scotians, during this very difficult time. He noted that all Canadians have the people of Nova Scotia in their thoughts, and offered his support to Premier McNeil. Both leaders recognized the efforts of the RCMP and other members of the ongoing investigation. 

The two leaders also discussed the COVID-19 pandemic, and the measures Nova Scotia has taken to curb outbreaks in the province’s long-term care facilities.  They reaffirmed their commitment to continued collaboration and coordination between their respective governments in addressing COVID-19.
